revised_title: Experimental Researches in Electricity: Crystalline Polarity of Bismuth and its Relation to Magnetic Force
tldr: Faraday investigates the crystalline polarity of bismuth and its relation to magnetic force. He discovers that bismuth, when subjected to a magnetic field, exhibits a strong diamagnetic response and takes up a final position determined by its crystalline structure. This phenomenon is observed to be independent of the shape of the bismuth sample, but rather dependent on its crystalline condition.
